text.p: A fire raged through 16 wooden houses in northeastern Taiwan early on Thursday, killing five people, Taiwan police said.
One person was critically injured. The blaze, which started after midnight, burned 14 of the houses to the ground before firefighters arrived.
The five dead were found in the living room of one of the houses.
"The wooden material of the houses made it very easy for the fire to spread, and all the houses were right next to each other," a fire official said.
The police estimated financial losses at T$5 million (US$180,000). They said arson was unlikely, but the cause of the fire has not been determined.
